revised_title: Discoveries on the Sex of Bees and Their Method of Propagation
tldr: The author, John Debraw, investigates the sex of bees and their method of propagation, challenging previous beliefs about bee reproduction. He discovers that bees do not engage in true copulation and that their eggs are likely impregnated by males through a process similar to that of fish. Debraw's findings contradict earlier theories and provide new insights into the reproductive behavior of bees.
